contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2011}} :''This article is about the [[Austria]]n singer. For the settlement in [[Emberá]] ''[[comarca]]'', [[Panama]], see [[Manuel Ortega, Emberá]]''. [[Image:Manuel Ortega 2008.jpg|thumb|Manuel Ortega, January 2008]] '''Manuel Ortega''', (born Manuel Hanke, [[Steyregg]], 8 April 1980) is an [[Austria]]n singer<ref name=bbcev>{{cite news|title=A vision of Euro musical riches|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1991471.stm|accessdate=4 February 2011|newspaper=[[BBC]]|date=17 May 2002|author=Michael Osborn}}</ref> of [[Spain|Spanish]] parents, born in [[Steyregg]]. When he was ten years old, he began his career as a singer. He sang with the [[Florianer Sängerknaben]] in one of the oldest choirs from Austria. His love for [[Popular music|pop music]] led to him joining a band called BAFF when he was a teenager. Starting from an early age, meant Ortega has been able to make over 200 stages performances as of 2003. When he was 17, he took part in a search for talent and was chosen out of 1300 entrants to be the singer of a new group. Whilst successful, the group was not enough for Ortega and in 2001 he began a solo career. The song ''El Amor, La Vida'' was the [[Austria]]n [[summer hit]] of [[2001 in music|2001]]. In 2002 he represented Austria in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]]<ref name=bbcev/> with the song ''[[Say A Word]]''. Because of his [[Spain|Spanish]] temperament Manuel Ortega soon became known as the Austrian [[Ricky Martin]],{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} although his talents include song writing as wel Manuel participated in the 3rd Season of the Ukrainian Dancing With the Stars (so-called ''International League of Champions'') where he danced with the Ukrainian ballroom dancer, and [[Eurovision Dance Contest 2007]] runner-up [[Yulia Okropiridze]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.manuelortega.net/ Official homepage] {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''Dancing Stars'' winner|before=Marika Lichter & Andy Kainz|after=Klaus Eberhartinger & Kelly Kainz|years=Season 2 (2006 with Kelly Kainz)}} {{succession box | before=[[The Rounder Girls]] | title=[[Austria in the Eurovision Song Contest]] | years=[[Eurovision Song Contest 2002|2002]] | after=[[Alf Poier]] }} {{s-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=80081975}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Ortega, Manuel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = April 8, 1980 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ortega, Manuel}} [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Urfahr-Umgebung District]] [[Category:Austrian male singers]] [[Category:Austrian people of Spanish descent]] [[Category:Austrian Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 2002]] [[Category:Dancing with the Stars winners]]
